name: Kevin Lee
label: Group Deputy Chief Credit Officer @ AIG General Insurance
summary: Creating synergies between algorithms and fundamental analysis to promote more aggressive credit and underwriting decisions.

highlights: Drive entry and exit discipline in credit underwriting including engaging clients; adjudicate exceptional referrals with the second highest credit authority in the company; issue moratoriums on credit assets and liabilities when necessary.
Coordinate credit risk-taking across both sides of balance sheet where ~40% of credit exposures overlap including corporate credit, structured credit, infrastructure credit, fund finance.
Design a scalable operating framework for $100B+ of credit positions through standardized processes, automation, Aladdin integration, outsourcing, and redesign of the technology stack.
Anticipate systemic risks, research market controversies, formulate active views quickly, and communicate portfolio implications to insurance and investment teams.

work_experience.position: Head of Risk, Global Credit & Specialty Insurance
highlights: Led the end-to-end risk management of AIG's $3 billion global credit & specialty insurance business with oversight of catastrophe, financial, operational, and model risks.
Socialized risk-adjusted performance targets to business heads incorporating internal capital and regulatory capital views.
Wrote annual risk review of business plans for property, credit, and specialty to underscore pressure points, advocate for additional investments, and inform Board's approval.
Promoted four times in four years; recommended and defended credit ratings of property-casualty, multiline, mortgage, and insurance-linked securities in the US, Bermuda, UK, Europe, and Russia.
Led ratings franchise for $3.3 billion of catastrophe bonds and other insurance-linked securities; partnered with bankers and issuers to design securities that could be rated.

Developed content library by authoring unique credit research including Japan Earthquake Q&A (top-ranked sell-side: “Nicely done and extremely useful”, reposted by Dowling & Partners); Mortgage Insurance (Freddie Mac: “Excellent analysis of the state of the industry”); Sidecars (CEO: “Best research [on the topic] anywhere on the street.”); Reinsurance Buyer Survey (EVP: “unique...nothing similar”)
Drove field execution using controllable income statements to mobilize agency plant, guide pricing, and steer capital allocation; conducted competitive intelligence of rivals.

Managed a run-off book that was a Group CFO watchlist item; negotiated ownership of data, reduced claims leakage by steering claims audits, correctly estimated reserves at 40% ($50 million) less than booked (Division Head: “someone finally got the reserves right”).
